name: 賀一平
objective: The purpose of this course is to develop students into better, more mature, confident, competent, enthusiastic, reflective, independent readers. Young adult novels and articles dealing with controversial issues are used as major reading materials. Response-oriented activities are provided to encourage students to transact with texts actively, and to improve their reading skills, reading strategies, response strategies, and critical thinking skills. Response-centered activities used in this classroom include journal writing, group discussion, oral presentation, individualized independent study, and guided reading. Journals, oral presentations, literature-circle group projects, and examinations are used to evaluate student performance and achievement.
